result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky J Balboa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any of the victims listed in the complaint.
Follow through with Sex Offender treatment.
Follow through with any programming recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Ricky J Balboa in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by J.G.  Statement by K.L.  Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count 1:  
JAIL:  9 months straight time; CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and any current sentence

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition as extended supervision in Count 2)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition as extended supervision in Count 2)


Count 2:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days); CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  any of the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint
*Follow through with sex offender treatment
*Follow through with any programming recommended by Agent
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is  not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Count 3:
JAIL:  9 months straight time; CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 2 and any current sentence

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition as extended supervision in Count 2)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition as extended supervision in Count 2)

Defendant Ricky J Balboa in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
